# DateComponentsFormatter.UnitsStyle.full

**Case**

A style that spells out the units of time, but not the quantities.

## Declaration

```swift
case full
```

## Discussion

For example, the quantity of 3 years, 9 months, 26 days, 19 hours, and 17 seconds is displayed in the U.S. English locale as “3 years, 9 months, 26 days, 19 hours, 17 seconds”.

## Styles

- **DateComponentsFormatter.UnitsStyle.spellOut**: A style that spells out the units and quantities of time.
- **DateComponentsFormatter.UnitsStyle.short**: A style that uses a shortened spelling for units.
- **DateComponentsFormatter.UnitsStyle.brief**: A style that uses a shortened spelling for units of time that is shorter than [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/DateComponentsFormatter/UnitsStyle-swift.enum/short].
- **DateComponentsFormatter.UnitsStyle.abbreviated**: A style that uses the most abbreviated spelling for units of time.
- **DateComponentsFormatter.UnitsStyle.positional**: A style that uses the position of a unit of time to identify its value.
